abstract.text: The molecular mechanisms that link IFN-3 genotypes to differential induction of interferon (IFN)-stimulated genes (ISGs) in the liver of patients with chronic hepatitis C (CHC) are not known. We measured the expression of IFN- and of the specific IFN- receptor chain (IFN-R1) in 122 liver biopsies of patients with CHC and 53 control samples. The IFN-3 genotype was not associated with differential expression of IFN-, but rather IFN-R1.

with CHC revealed a strong association of high IFN-R1 expression with elevated ISG expression, with IFN-3 minor alleles, and with nonresponse to pegylated IFN- and ribavirin. The findings provide a missing link between the IFN-3 genotype and the associated phenotype of treatment nonresponse.

body_text.text: Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infects an estimated 130-170 million persons worldwide. Chronic hepatitis C (CHC) can lead to cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma (Lauer and Walker, 2001) . The treatment for CHC consists of pegylated IFN (peg-IFN)- and ribavirin, complemented with the HCV protease inhibitors telaprevir or boceprevir for HCV genotype 1 (Ghany et al., 2011) . A substantial proportion of patients do not respond to this treatment. The virological response to peg-IFN- depends on the degree of activation of the endogenous IFN system in the liver (Chen et al., 2005; Asselah et al., 2008; Dill et al., 2011) . Paradoxically, patients with a strong host response to HCV infection whose immune system reacts with a sustained induction of hundreds of IFN-stimulated genes (ISGs) in the liver, in the following designated preactivated patients, are poor responders to peg-IFN- treatments. Nonresponse to peg-IFN- in preactivated patients is most likely the consequence of the permanent up-regulation of USP18, an inhibitor of IFN- signaling through the Jak-STAT pathways (Malakhova et al., 2006; Sarasin-Filipowicz et al., 2009; Dill et al., 2012) .

The molecular mechanisms responsible for sustained ISG induction in the liver are unknown. The presence of a T cell infiltrate in the liver of CHC patients suggests that IFN- could stimulate ISG induction. However, several groups have reported that the CD8 + T cell response is dysfunctional in regard to IFN- secretion (Thimme et al., 2012) . Indeed, gene set enrichment analysis revealed a significant enrichment of IFN-induced genes in liver biopsies of preactivated We found a very low expression of IFN-R1 in PHHs and in liver biopsies from patients who were not infected with HCV. In PHHs, IFN-R1 expression was induced by IFN-, leading to substantially improved responses of the Jak-STAT signaling pathway to IFN-. The magnitude of IFN-induced IFN-R1 expression was significantly associated with the IFN-3 genotype. IFN-R1 expression was significantly higher in liver biopsies from patients with CHC compared with uninfected controls. Within the group of patients with CHC, IFN-R1 expression significantly correlated with the IFN-3 genotype. We conclude that the IFN-3 genotype affects hepatic ISG expression not through differential expression of IFN-3, but through differential expression of its receptor IFN-R1. Moreover, ex vivo treatment of liver biopsies from patients with high-level expression of IFN-R1 showed strong responses to IFN- and poor responses to IFN-, whereas the contrary was found in patients with low-level expression of IFN-R1. These findings provide a rationale for treating peg-IFN- nonresponder patients with peg-IFN-.

The strong association of minor alleles of the IFN-3 polymorphism with HCV persistence and poor response to peg-IFN- and ribavirin treatment provides compelling evidence for an important role of the IFN- system in the host reaction to HCV. We therefore measured the expression of IFN-1, IFN-2/3, and IFN-R1 by quantitative PCR (qPCR) in liver biopsies. Because of the high sequence similarity of 97%, IFN-2 and IFN-3 mRNA were quantified together using one primer pair that binds to both IFN-2 and IFN-3. IFN-1 mRNA was detectable in 33 and IFN-2/3 mRNA in 24 of 53 CHC samples tested ( Fig. 1 A) . We could not detect IFN-1 or IFN-2/3 in 22 control biopsies from patients without CHC. Interestingly, IFN-1 and IFN-2/3 mRNA were detectable in 3 and in 20 of 31 samples from patients with CHB, respectively ( Fig. 1 A) .
body_text.section: Inducible expression of IFN-1, IFN-2/3, and IFN-R1 in human liver and PHHs

body_text.text: IFN-R1 mRNA was measured in 53 controls, 122 samples from patients with CHC, and 31 samples from patients with CHB and was detectable in all 206 biopsies ( Fig. 1 A) . The median expression level of IFN-R1 mRNA expressed as copies per 40 ng of total RNA was 482.5 in CHC samples, which is significantly higher compared with control samples with a median value of 130.0 (Mann-Whitney test; P < 0.001). IFN-R1 expression was also strongly induced in CHB samples, with a median expression level of 712 copies per 40 ng of total RNA (Fig. 1 A) .
body_text.section: Inducible expression of IFN-1, IFN-2/3, and IFN-R1 in human liver and PHHs

body_text.text: We then used a recently adapted in situ hybridization (ISH) method to identify the cell types with IFN-R1 expression in human liver biopsies. Most of the specific signals were detected in hepatocytes ( Fig. 1 B) . We also detected signals near the sinusoids that could not unequivocally be localized in hepatocytes. We conclude that the major source IFN-R1 receptor mRNA measured by qPCR from liver biopsy extracts are patients with CHC, contrary to the late phase of acute hepatitis C that is characterized by a strong enrichment of IFN-induced ISGs (Dill et al., 2012) . However, IFN-s are probably not the drivers of ISG induction because IFN- signaling is subject to a strong negative feedback inhibition by USP18 that would prevent long-lasting activation of ISGs (Malakhova et al., 2006; Sarasin-Filipowicz et al., 2009) . Interestingly, IFN- signaling is not affected by USP18 to the same extent as IFN-, despite the fact that both IFN- and IFN- belong to the type I IFN family and bind to and signal through the same receptor, IFNAR (Makowska et al., 2011) . IFN- produced by HCV-infected hepatocytes therefore remains a serious contender for being the driver of ISG expression in CHC. However, neither type I nor type II IFNs have been consistently detected in liver biopsies of preactivated patients with CHC.
body_text.section: Inducible expression of IFN-1, IFN-2/3, and IFN-R1 in human liver and PHHs

body_text.text: The discovery, in 2009, that allelic variants near the IFN-3 (IL28B) gene are strongly associated with spontaneous clearance of HCV and with response to treatment with peg-IFN- and ribavirin provided compelling evidence that the type III IFN system is a key component of the host reaction to the virus Suppiah et al., 2009; Tanaka et al., 2009; Thomas et al., 2009; Rauch et al., 2010) . The molecular mechanisms that link the allelic variants of the IFN-3 gene locus to nonresponse to peg-IFN- and ribavirin are not fully understood, but the significant association of the minor alleles of the IFN-3 polymorphism with the induction of ISGs in the liver demonstrates that the IFN- system must be critically involved in regulating the innate immune response to HCV (Honda et al., 2010; Urban et al., 2010) . More recently, a novel TT/-G polymorphism near the IFN-3 gene has been described that is even more strongly associated with spontaneous clearance and treatment response to peg-IFN- and ribavirin in CHC (Bibert et al., 2013; Prokunina-Olsson et al., 2013) . The frameshift variant -G creates a novel 179-aa open reading frame that was designated IFN-4 on the basis of its protein sequence homology with type III IFNs (Prokunina-Olsson et al., 2013) . Recombinant IFN-4 signals through the IFN- receptor and has antiviral activity against HCV and coronaviruses in cell culture (Hamming et al., 2013) . It is presently not known whether IFN-4 is actually produced and functionally important in the HCV-infected human liver. Interestingly, the newly discovered TT/-G polymorphism impacts IFN- production in PBMCs. Treatment of PBMCs from patients with at least one -G allelic variant with poly(I:C) resulted in significant lower induction of IFN-3 compared with PBMCs from patients homozygous for the major TT allele (Bibert et al., 2013) . How lower amounts of IFN-3 can be linked to increased expression of ISGs in the liver or how IFN-4 could cause a long-lasting ISG induction is presently unknown, but these exciting new findings further point to an important role of the IFN- gene locus in the control of the host response to HCV. We therefore analyzed the expression of IFN-s and their receptor IFN-R1 (IL28R) in liver biopsies and primary human hepatocytes (PHHs) from patients with different IFN-3 genotypes.
body_text.section: Inducible expression of IFN-1, IFN-2/3, and IFN-R1 in human liver and PHHs

body_text.text: To further define the IFN-R1 expression levels required for the activation of the Jak-STAT signaling pathway and the induction of ISGs by IFN-s, we generated several Huh7derived clones stably transfected with IFN-R1 and selected three of them with different receptor expression levels, designated LR clones 1, 2, and 3 (Fig. 3, A and B ). The parent Huh7 clone used for these experiments has very low IFN-R1 expression and consequently showed only weak phosphorylation of STAT1 upon IFN-2 treatment and absent or only very weak induction of ISGs (Fig. 3 , C and D). body_text.section: Cellular responses to IFN- correlate with IFN-R1 expression levels

body_text.text: The induction of IFN-R1 specifically in patients with CHC is reminiscent of the induction of hundreds of ISGs in a substantial proportion of patients with CHC (Chen et al., 2005; Asselah et al., 2008; . Furthermore, it has been reported that the promoter of IFN-R1 contains a binding site for the IFN- signal transducer STAT1 (Yang et al., 2010) . We therefore tested whether IFN-R1 is an ISG in PHHs. Indeed, we found a significant induction of IFN-R1 both on the transcript and the protein level within hours after IFN- stimulation (Fig. 2,  A and B) . The IFN--induced up-regulation of IFN-R1 had important consequences for the responsiveness of PHHs to IFN-2. Treatment-naive PHHs showed poor to absent phosphorylation of STAT1 in response to 100 ng/ml IFN-2. The expression of IFN-1, IFN-2/3, and IFN-R1 was measured in liver biopsy extracts from CHC (n = 53 for IFN-1 and IFN-2/3; n = 122 for IFN-R1), non-CHC (n = 22 for IFN-1 and IFN-2/3; n = 53 for IFN-R1), and HBV (n = 31) samples by qPCR. Red lines show the statistical median of the individual data points. Statistical analysis was performed using the nonparametric Mann-Whitney test: ***, P < 0.001. Signals (red dots) are predominantly located in hepatocytes. Some signals are localized close to sinusoids. Nuclei are stained with DAPI (blue). Shown are representative images from biopsies A795, A909, A622, and A606. The IFN-3 rs12979860 genotype is indicated below the biopsy number. Pictures were obtained from two CHC patients homozygous for the IFN-3 rs12979860 C allele (A795 and A909) and two CHC patients carrying one or two T alleles (A622 and A606). Shown are representative images from three sections for each patient. Bar, 20 µm. expression level of IFN-R1. We conclude that in unstimulated PHHs, the IFN-R1 expression level is low and IFN--induced activation of the Jak-STAT pathway is weak. Responsiveness to IFN- strongly increases after induction of IFN-R1.

body_text.text: There was considerable variation of IFN-R1 mRNA expression among the CHC samples ( Fig. 1 A) . To investigate the influence of IFN-3 genotypes on IFN-R1 expression, we genotyped CHC samples for the rs12979860 and for the rs8099917 single-nucleotide polymorphisms. We found significantly higher IFN-R1 expression in samples from patients having one or two minor IFN-3 alleles (Fig. 4 A) . To investigate the mechanisms responsible for the association of the IFN-3 genotype with IFN-R1 expression, we genotyped PHH samples from 30 donors not infected with HCV (Table S1) , stimulated them for 4 h with IFN-, and measured the mRNA expression of IFN-R1 and two well-characterized ISGs, i.e., STAT1 and RSAD2. In unstimulated PHHs, the expression of all three genes was low, independent of the IFN-3 genotype (Fig. 4 , B and C). IFN- treatment resulted in a significant induction of all three genes in all samples. For STAT1 had stepwise increased expression levels of IFN-R1 and showed corresponding increases in Jak-STAT activation and ISG induction by C and D) . Of note, a significant increase in responses to IFN-2 was only observed in clones with IFN-R1 expression of >0.005 relative to GAPDH. Interestingly, IFN-2-induced ISG expression in LR clone 2 and 3 cells increased over time during a 24-h treatment period ( Fig. 3 D) . This is in contrast to the IFN--induced ISG expression that is typically transient because of the well-known refractoriness of IFN- signal transduction pathways in Huh7 cells and liver cells (Larner et al., 1986; Sarasin-Filipowicz et al., 2009; Makowska et al., 2011) . In accordance with these published results, IFN- induced only transient phosphorylation of STAT1 (Fig. 3 E) . Contrariwise, IFN- signaling showed no refractoriness but prolonged stimulation of the Jak-STAT pathway in LR clone 3 cells (Fig. 3 E) .

body_text.text: To further address the pharmacological response to IFN- and IFN-, we used an ex vivo treatment protocol using liver biopsy pieces. 2-3-mm-long biopsy cylinder pieces of 1-mm diameter were transferred into test tubes and either left untreated or stimulated with IFN- or IFN- for 15 min. The method was previously used and validated in liver biopsies with different fibrosis stages including cirrhosis (Duong et al., 2004) . The activation of the Jak-STAT pathway was assessed by immunostaining of fresh-frozen biopsy material with phospho-STAT1-specific antibodies. For each sample, confocal microscope pictures of three random fields were obtained and used to quantify the number of nuclei with phospho-STAT1 signals. The expression of IFN-R1 was quantified by qPCR. Two liver biopsies from uninfected patients were used as controls. In these samples, IFN- induced nuclear phospho-STAT1 signals in most cells, predominantly in hepatocytes, whereas IFN- was ineffective (Fig. 6, A and B) . The same response pattern was observed in samples from patients with CHC and low expression of the IFN-R1 (Figs. 7 A and 8) .
body_text.section: IFN-R1 expression is significantly associated with the IFN-3 genotype

body_text.text: The results were strikingly different in biopsies with high expression levels of IFN-R1. In many of these samples, nuclear phospho-STAT1 signals were detectable already in the PBS samples, and IFN- rarely elicited further responses. On the contrary, IFN- was able to increase nuclear phospho-STAT1 signals in all nine biopsy samples with high IFN-R1 (Figs. 7 B and 8). Based on these ex vivo data, we conclude that there is an inverse correlation between responsiveness to IFN- and IFN- in human liver of patients with CHC. Thus, we propose that patients with high-level pretreatment expression of ISGs in the liver, who according to previously published work often respond poorly to IFN- (Chen et al., 2005; Asselah et al., 2008; Dill et al., 2011) , might indeed have better responses to IFN- because of significantly increased expression of IFN-R1.

body_text.text: The discovery that genetic variants near the IFN-3 gene locus are strongly associated with spontaneous clearance of HCV by the host immune system and with response to therapy of CHC with peg-IFN- and ribavirin was an important milestone in HCV research Suppiah et al., 2009; Tanaka et al., 2009; Rauch et al., 2010) . IFN- (IL28B) genotyping rapidly became a useful tool for clinicians for predicting the likelihood of treatment response of an individual patient, and it became essential for stratifying patients enrolled in clinical treatment trials with peg-IFN--containing regimens. The discovery was also important for basic research of host-virus interactions because it identified the previously neglected and RSAD2, the magnitude of gene induction was not significantly associated with the IFN-3 genotype. Contrariwise, there was a significantly stronger induction of IFN-R1 in samples having one or two minor IFN-3 alleles (Fig. 4, B and C) .
body_text.section: DISCUSSION

body_text.text: To address whether the response to treatment with peg-IFN- and ribavirin is influenced by the expression level of IFN-R1 in the liver, we reanalyzed the expression values of liver biopsy samples of patients with CHC for whom we had complete virological response data (Table S2 ). There were 21 samples from patients who had a sustained virological response defined as the absence of detectable HCV RNA in the serum 6 mo after the end of the treatment. 27 samples were from patients who did not respond to peg-IFN- and ribavirin and remained . (B and C) PHHs from 30 non-CHC donors were stimulated for 4 h with 1,000 IU/ml IFN-. IFN-R1, STAT1, and RSAD2 expression were measured by qPCR. The samples were genotyped for IFN-3 minor alleles compared with major alleles rs12979860 (CC, n = 16; CT/TT, n = 14; B) and rs8099917 (TT, n = 19; TG/GG, n = 11; C). Statistical analysis was performed using the Mann-Whitney test: **, P < 0.01; ***, P < 0.001.
body_text.section: IFN-R1 expression is significantly associated with response to peg-IFN- plus ribavirin treatment of CHC

body_text.text: In CHC patients, IFN-1 and -2/3 are detected by qPCR in about half of the samples, mostly at low expression levels. In agreement with published work, we did not find a correlation between IFN- expression and response to treatment or the IFN-3 genotype. We therefore think that we can exclude differential regulation of IFN-1 and -2/3 as the missing link between the IFN-3 genotype and ISG expression. A very interesting alternative explanation has been generated by the recent discovery of a frame shift variant located upstream of the IFN-3 gene (Prokunina-Olsson et al., 2013) . This variant creates a new open reading frame of 179 aa that has been designated IFN-4. Despite considerable sequence diversity between IFN-4 and the other members of the IFN- family, recombinant IFN-4 signals through the IFN-R to induce an antiviral state against HCV and coronaviruses (Hamming et al., 2013) . It is immediately obvious that the exclusive production of IFN-4 from the minor IFN-3 alleles (more precisely from the ss469415590-G allele) together with the stronger induction of IFN-R1 in the liver of patients with one or two minor alleles (Fig. 4) provide an attractive explanation for the high level of ISG expression in these patients. For the moment, IFN- system as a key component of the host immune answer to HCV. However, the mechanisms that link IFN-3 genotypes with spontaneous HCV clearance and with response to peg-IFN- remained elusive. Important insights came from studies that linked IFN-3 genotypes with hepatic ISG expression in CHC (Honda et al., 2010; Urban et al., 2010) . Differential activation of the endogenous IFN system in the liver has previously been established as a major determinant of response to peg-IFN- and ribavirin (Chen et al., 2005; Asselah et al., 2008; . Patients with an activated IFN system are generally poor responders to peg-IFN- therapy. Therefore, an increased production and secretion of IFN- from minor alleles compared with major IFN-3 alleles would be an obvious explanation for the association of the minor IFN-3 alleles with increased ISG expression in the liver. However, several groups have failed to find increased expression levels of IFN- family members in the serum or the liver of patients with minor IFN-3 alleles (Honda et al., 2010; Urban et al., 2010; Dill et al., 2011) . In the present work, we provide evidence that the link between the IFN-3 genotype and hepatic ISG expression is based on differential expression of the IFN-R1 receptor, and not by differential induction of the IFN- ligands. The receptor is detectably expressed in all liver biopsies. The median expression value is significantly higher in samples from patients with CHC, and within the group of CHC samples, there is significantly increased expression in patients carrying the minor IFN-3 allele (compared with the major allele) and in patients who were nonresponders to peg-IFN- and ribavirin therapy (compared with patients who were cured by this treatment). These results are in accordance with previous published results showing an elevated expression of IFNLR1 in patients with CHC infection compared with controls and in Huh7.5 cells infected with HCVcc (cell culture-derived infectious HCV; Dolganiuc et al., 2012; Kohli et al., 2012) .

Nuclei were stained with DAPI (in yellow). (B) Liver biopsies from patient B769 were incubated ex vivo in PBS or IFN- for 15 min, and phospho-STAT1 signals were detected by immunofluorescence using anti-pY-STAT1 monoclonal antibody conjugated to Alexa Fluor 555. Images from fluorescence channels (red for phospho-STAT1 and blue for nuclei) were merged with the corresponding brightfield image. induction of IFN-R1 upon IFN- stimulation according to their IFN-3 genotype (Fig. 4, B and C) provides an important missing link between genotype and phenotype. We propose that early during HCV infection the host innate immune system reacts with the induction of type I (IFN- or IFN-) and/or III (IFN-) IFN. In individuals with one or two minor IFN-3 alleles, there is a strong induction of the IFN-R1. This induction is maintained through a positive feedback loop, and IFN-R1 remains constitutively induced together with hundreds of other ISGs. In this group of patients, peg-IFN- is ineffective, most likely because of the permanent induction of the ISG USP18, a strong inhibitor of signaling through the IFN- receptor (Sarasin-Filipowicz et al., 2009; François-Newton et al., 2011; Dill et al., 2012) . On the other side, in patients homozygous for the major IFN-3 allele, the induction of IFN-R1 remains below a critical threshold for the positive feedback loop, and ISG induction fades away. These non-preactivated patients are highly responsive to peg-IFN-, most likely because IFN- signaling is not refractory.
body_text.section: Figure 6. Ex vivo treatment of liver biopsies with IFN- and IFN-.

body_text.text: Peg-IFN-1 is currently undergoing clinical development for the treatment of viral hepatitis. A phase 1b and a phase 2b study demonstrated antiviral activity in patients with CHC and minimal adverse events and hematologic effects (Muir et al., 2010; Muir, A.J., et al. 2012) . The 63rd Annual Meeting of the American Association for the Study of Liver Diseases: The Liver Meeting. Abstr. 214). The better tolerability of peg-IFN-1 is presumably caused by the restricted tissue distribution of its receptor. Lymphocytes or monocytes are unresponsive to IFN- . The antiviral activity of peg-IFN-1 is probably mediated through a direct stimulation of the IFN- receptor on hepatocytes. In tissue blots, IFN-R1 is detectable in the liver (Sheppard et al., 2003) , and IFN- had antiviral activity and/or activated Jak-STAT signaling in several hepatoma cells lines and PHHs, albeit often with lower efficacy compared with IFN- (Robek et al., 2005; Doyle et al., 2006; Marcello et al., 2006; Dickensheets et al., 2013) . In vivo, the response to IFN- in the human liver has not been investigated. Interestingly, in the mouse liver, we and others have found very little IFN-R1 expression and little to absent Jak-STAT stimulation in the liver in response to systemic application of mouse IFN- (Sommereyns et al., 2008; Makowska et al., 2011) .

body_text.text: In the present extensive analysis of IFN-R1 expression in human liver biopsies, we measured rather low expression levels in samples from patients not infected with HCV. Thus, the noninfected human liver has very little response to IFN-. This state of relative unresponsiveness could protect the liver from overstimulation by IFN- produced during gastrointestinal viral infections and transported via the portal vein into the hepatic circulation.
body_text.section: Figure 6. Ex vivo treatment of liver biopsies with IFN- and IFN-.

body_text.text: IFN-R1 expression is not increased in all CHC patients, but rather predominantly in patients with an induced IFN system in the liver who usually are carriers of the IFN-3 minor allele. This differential expression can be explained by the fact that IFN-R1 is an ISG. The association of IFN-R1 expression with the IFN-3 minor allele has important consequences however, our attempts to detect IFN-4 mRNA in liver biopsies failed. Thus, further investigations are needed to clarify whether IFN-4 is indeed the cytokine responsible for elevated ISG expression in patients with CHC.

body_text.text: Despite the fact that IFN-s are not detectable in a substantial percentage of patients with CHC, we think that the IFN- system is the most likely candidate for the continuous up-regulation of hundreds of ISGs in preactivated patients. Contrary to IFN- signaling, IFN- signaling does not become refractory during prolonged stimulation (Fig. 3 D; Makowska et al., 2011) . Moreover, the strength of IFN--induced activation of the Jak-STAT pathway is regulated to a large degree by the expression of the IFN-R1 (Figs. 2, 3, 7, and 8) . Because IFN-R1 is an ISG itself, the IFN- system can undergo a positive feedback loop that can be maintained as long as there is a minimal amount of IFN- ligands to stimulate the expression of IFN-R1. Specimens were then embedded in Tissue-Tek OCT (Sakura) and frozen in liquid nitrogen. Cryosections of 8-µm thickness were prepared and used for immunostaining analysis.

Sections were mounted with Mount FluorCare DAPI (Carl Roth GmbH).

body_text.text: Fluorescence ISH. For the present study, we adapted a highly sensitive and specific ISH system (QuantiGene ViewRNA; Affymetrix) using a custom probe set targeting IFN-R1 (IL28RA; Affymetrix; GenBank accession no. NM_ 170743). In brief, 10-µm sections from OCT-embedded liver biopsies were prepared, mounted onto Superfrost Plus Gold glass slides (Thermo Fischer Scientific), and kept at 80°C until use. Upon fixation, washing, and dehydration in ethanol, sections were digested in Protease QF (Affymetrix) and then hybridized with custom-designed QuantiGene ViewRNA probes against target RNA sequences. Bound probes were preamplified and subsequently amplified according to the manufacturer's instructions. Probe oligonucleotide conjugated to alkaline phosphatase type 1 was added, followed by Fast Red substrate. Finally, slides were counterstained with Meyer's hematoxylin and embedded with DAPI-containing aqueous mounting medium (Roti-Mount FluorCare DAPI; Roth AG).

Online supplemental material is available at http://www.jem.org/cgi/content/full/jem.20131557/DC1. for the use of peg-IFN-1 for the treatment of CHC. Collectively with the results from our ex vivo stimulation experiments ( Figs. 7 and 8) , the findings provide a rationale for the preferential use of peg-IFN-1 in patients with an induced hepatic IFN system who are usually responding poorly to the current standard of care treatment regiments that contain peg-IFN-. On the negative side, peg-IFN-1 could have only limited efficiency in patients with an uninduced endogenous IFN system because of a below-threshold expression of the IFN- receptor. A quantification of IFN-R1 mRNA in liver biopsies could therefore help to select the most promising peg-IFN (peg-IFN- vs. peg-IFN-) to be included in the treatment regimens of individual patients.

body_text.text: Huh7 cells were cultured in DMEM supplemented with 10% FBS and penicillin/streptomycin. The coding sequence of IFN-R1 was amplified from a commercially available IMAGE human cDNA clone (catalog number EHA10001-99865534; Thermo Fisher Scientific) using the primers 5-TTTT-CTAGACGGCAGGAAGGCCATGGC-3 and 5-TCTAGACCTGGC-CATGTAATGCCCCAAT-3 and then cloned into a pcDNA3.V5-His vector with XbaI restriction sites. The expression plasmid was transfected into Huh7 cells using FuGENE HD (Roche). Cells were then selected with DMEM culture medium supplemented with 10% FBS and 1 mg/ml G418 (EMD Millipore) to generate stable IFN-R1-expressing clones.

body_text.text: Patients. Liver biopsies from CHC and non-CHC patients were obtained in the outpatient clinic of the Division of Gastroenterology and Hepatology, University Hospital Basel. Parts of the biopsy material that were not needed for routine histopathology were used for research purposes after obtaining written informed consent. The use of biopsy material for this project was approved by the Ethikkommission Nordwest-und Zentralschweiz, Basel, Switzerland, protocol number M989/99. Grading and staging of CHC was defined according to the METAVIR classification. Serum HCV RNA was quantified using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV Test and the COBAS Amplicor Monitor from Roche. Response to treatment in CHC patients was defined as described previously (Dill et al., 2011) . Diagnosis of non-CHC patients was based on clinical, laboratory, and histopathological assessment according to routine clinical practice. CHC and non-CHC patients' characteristics are summarized in Tables S2 and S3, respectively.
